title: Circle - Pointwise Pythagorean Definition
latex: $C \in \mathbb{R}^2$ is a { f circle} if and only if $C$ is non-empty, $\exists p \in \mathbb{R}^2$ such that $ orall x, y \in C, (x_1 - p_1)^2 + (x_2 - p_2)^2 = (y_1 - p_1)^2 + (y_2 - p_2)^2$ and $ orall z \in \mathbb{R}^2$ if $\exists x \in C$ such that $(x_1 - p_1)^2 + (x_2 - p_2)^2 = (z_1 - p_1)^2 + (z_2 - p_2)^2$ then $z \in \mathbb{R}^2$.
